intro: Carex leucorhiza, commonly known as white-root sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its triangular stems and grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikes, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds. Carex leucorhiza plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
